meanings.sent1: The palmister studied the lines on my hand to tell me about my future.
meanings.sent2: The palmister had a small booth at the fair where people lined up to have their palms read.
meanings.sent3: The palmister joked that my palm lines showed I would eat too many cookies in the future.
meanings.sent4: The palmister's skill as a fortune-teller was as clear as the lines on my palm.
meanings.sent5: The palmister's accurate predictions made me a believer in palmistry.

meanings.definition: To predict the future by reading the lines on someone's palm.
meanings.sent1: I watched as the palmister carefully palmistered my friend's hand, foretelling good things to come.
meanings.sent2: She decided to palmister her own future by studying palmistry books and practicing on willing friends.
meanings.sent3: The palmister palmistered with such confidence that even skeptics were intrigued by her readings.
meanings.sent4: His ability to palmister the future seemed almost magical, as if he held the secrets of time in his hands.
meanings.sent5: As she began to palmister my future, I felt a mix of excitement and curiosity about what she would reveal.
